articles.title: As New Services Roil P2P, Fiserv Gets Set to Shut Down Its Popmoney Network
articles.summary: Fiserv Inc. is discontinuing its Popmoney peer-to-peer payments service on June 30, prioritizing the bank-owned Zelle network due to its success and growing demand for faster payments. The move comes amidst an increasingly competitive P2P market, with pressure from services like Zelle, PayPal, Venmo, and the upcoming real-time payments service from the Federal Reserve, as well as Visa's new interoperability network. Fiserv acquired Popmoney's originator, CashEdge, in 2011 and integrated it into its services.

articles.title: Franklin to Add Retirement AUM With Putnam Acquisition
articles.summary: Franklin Templeton announced its agreement to acquire Putnam Investments for $925 million from Power Corp. of Canada. This acquisition aims to boost Franklin Templeton's asset management scale and capabilities in the retirement plan sector, increasing its defined contribution assets under management to approximately $90 billion. The deal also includes Great-West committing $25 billion to Franklin Templeton's specialist investment managers and taking a 6.2% stake in Franklin.

articles.title: Latham & Watkins Advises the Underwriters in EVgoâ€™s Public Equity Offering
articles.summary: Latham & Watkins LLP advised the underwriters in EVgo Inc.'s public offering of 29,411,765 shares of Class A common stock priced at US$4.25 per share. J.P. Morgan, Evercore ISI, and Goldman Sachs & Co. LLC were lead book-running managers. The offering, which included a 30-day option for underwriters to purchase additional shares, closed on May 22, 2023.

articles.title: Capital One Buys Concierge App Offering Dolomite Skiing, Sperm Whale Swimming
articles.summary: Capital One Financial Corp. has agreed to acquire the digital concierge service Velocity Black. This acquisition aims to enhance Capital One's offerings in premium credit cards and luxury markets, directly competing with American Express Co. and JPMorgan Chase & Co. Velocity Black specializes in luxury travel, entertainment, shopping, and dining, having previously raised $28 million in venture capital.

articles.title: Cummins Spinoff Atmus Raises $275 Million in IPO
articles.summary: Cummins Inc. spinoff Atmus Filtration Technologies Inc. raised $275 million in its initial public offering, with shares rising 11% in their trading debut. The company, which manufactures filters for commercial vehicles and other equipment, has a market value of $1.8 billion and its IPO marks the seventh-biggest on a U.S. exchange this year. Cummins retains an 83% ownership stake in Atmus.

articles.title: Culture Wars Hit Capital One
articles.summary: Capital One has had its New York City deposits frozen due to its failure to submit required anti-discrimination plans, a move by the NYC Comptroller amidst larger "culture wars" affecting banks nationwide. This action by NYC contrasts with states like Texas and Florida, which have taken steps to ban financial institutions that they perceive as not aligning with conservative values regarding ESG practices. The situation highlights divergent approaches by different states and municipalities in holding financial institutions accountable for their policies.
